clinical_study.brief_title: Defibrotide in Sickle Cell Disease-Related Acute Chest Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study to Determine the Safety of Defibrotide in Sickle Cell Disease-Related Acute Chest Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the safety of defibrotide in subjects with sickle cell disease (SCD)-associated acute chest syndrome (ACS).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with grade III/IV allergic reaction to defibrotide
primary_outcome.description: All patients will be monitored for allergic reaction probably or definitely related to defibrotide administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with grade III/IV hemorrhage
primary_outcome.description: All patients will be monitored for hemorrhage probably or definitely related to defibrotide.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with improvement in clinical signs of Acute Chest Syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will have pre and post treatment assessments with imaging and blood tests to monitor clinical signs of ACS

intervention.description: Defibrotide 6.25 mg/kg IV q6h up to 7 days
